SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

com.vilt.minium
Annotation Type Async

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Async

Minium methods that perform some kind of client asynchronous operation must have this annotation. Right now, only methods that do not return WebElements are allowed to be marked as asynchronous.

In pratical terms, instead of calling the method JavascriptExecutor.executeScript(String, Object...) to evaluate the Minium expression, the engine will call JavascriptExecutor.executeAsyncScript(String, Object...).

Also, the javascript function corresponding to the declared method must receive an extra argument that will correspond to the callback function, which must be used to return this function asynchronously.

Author:
rui.figueira
See Also:
JavascriptExecutor.executeAsyncScript(String, Object...)
